alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 16 at 4:50PM EDT until April 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of eastern Upper Michigan, including the following county, Luce. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent snowmelt and ongoing rainfall has already resulted in rises on streams and rivers. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are forecast through 2 AM EDT Monday. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
